Accessibility.Feedback: The required reading material is not specific in some lectures. In particular, the material required for weeks 4, 6, and 7 are too broad

Appropriateness.Feedback: There are too much repetition of content. The material is not well-structured, and the new knowledge is not delivered in a gradual manner. In particular, there is not much substance in many of the slides. Take lecture 3 as an example. The DP algorithms are not presented properly. Another example is lecture 9. There is NO substance in it.

Accuracy.Feedback: There are numerous errors in the slides, particularly in terms of mathematical expressions. Take the first set of slides as an example. The equations (1) and (2) are both wrong. The equations (6) and (7) use notion $G_t$ which is never defined. The symbol $R$ is used with various different meanings with no consistency. Similarly, in lecture 3, the symbol $R$ and $r$ are used interchangeably with no consistency.

Alignment.Feedback: The description is too dry and literal, but does expand slightly on the material in the slides

Coherence.Feedback: Given that the core parts of the material fall apart, the course material is not usable.

Alignment.Feedback: The administrative material seems OK, but the slides and scripts are not at all.

Usability.Feedback: The material structure is fine, and the actual contents of the slides and the scripts are not at all.
